intro: Tragia shankii, commonly known as the African burr bush, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that releases seeds with hooked bristles, aiding in seed dispersal by attaching to animal fur. Tragia shankii is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
